ConfigurationsREST Resource

The endpoints for managing configuration import and export.

GET /orgs/{org_id}/configurations/exports/history

Get the configuration export history.

Request Parameters
name type description default constraints
accept header The requested MIME type for the return. This should generally be application/json.    
accept-language header The Accept-Language header as specified in RFC2616. The server will attempt to respect this setting for any formatted date strings that it returns.    
handle_format header The output format for objectHandle objects. See objectHandleFormat for the list of possible values.    
text_content_output_format header The output format for textContentDTO objects. See textContentOutputFormat for the list of possible values.    
threat_hit_prop_format header The output format for threat hit property objects. See threatHitPropertyFormat for the list of possible values.    
x-co3contexttoken header The contents of this token should be taken from the Co3ContextToken header of the JMS or STOMP message.

REST API clients that are not running in the context of an Actions Module invocation can ignore this header.

    
org_id path The organization ID.   int
limit query 50 int
max_id query   int
Response Codes
code condition
200 Success
400 Bad request
401 Unauthorized - most commonly, the provided session ID is invalid
403 Forbidden - most commonly, user authentication failed
404 Object not found
409 Conflicting PUT operation
500 Internal error
503 Service unavailable - usually related to LDAP not being accessible
Response Body
media type data type
application/json ConfigurationExportsHistoryDTO (JSON)

name type description default constraints

accept-language header The Accept-Language header as specified in RFC2616. The server will attempt to respect this setting for any formatted date strings that it returns.

REST API clients that are not running in the context of an Actions Module invocation can ignore this header.

limit query 50 int
max_id query   int

name type description default constraints

REST API clients that are not running in the context of an Actions Module invocation can ignore this header.

POST /orgs/{org_id}/configurations/exports/{export_id}

Get a previously exported configuration using POST instead of GET. This will trigger a file download.

Request Parameters
name type description default constraints
csrfToken formdata An optional form field to supply the session CSRF token if it cannot be passed by header.    
accept header The requested MIME type for the return. This should generally be application/json.    
accept-language header The Accept-Language header as specified in RFC2616. The server will attempt to respect this setting for any formatted date strings that it returns.    
handle_format header The output format for objectHandle objects. See objectHandleFormat for the list of possible values.    
text_content_output_format header The output format for textContentDTO objects. See textContentOutputFormat for the list of possible values.    
threat_hit_prop_format header The output format for threat hit property objects. See threatHitPropertyFormat for the list of possible values.    
x-co3contexttoken header The contents of this token should be taken from the Co3ContextToken header of the JMS or STOMP message.

REST API clients that are not running in the context of an Actions Module invocation can ignore this header.

    
export_id path The internal ID of the configuration to get.   int
org_id path The organization ID.   int
limit query 50 int
max_id query   int
Response Codes
code condition
200 Success
400 Bad request
401 Unauthorized - most commonly, the provided session ID is invalid
403 Forbidden - most commonly, user authentication failed
404 Object not found
409 Conflicting PUT operation
500 Internal error
503 Service unavailable - usually related to LDAP not being accessible

media type data type

POST /orgs/{org_id}/configurations/imports

Upload a configuration for import. This will validate the supplied file and prepare it for import.

Request Parameters
name type description default constraints
csrfToken formdata An optional form field to supply the session CSRF token if it cannot be passed by header.    
uploadedInputStream formdata The configuration file that is being uploaded.    
accept header The requested MIME type for the return. This should generally be application/json.    
accept-language header The Accept-Language header as specified in RFC2616. The server will attempt to respect this setting for any formatted date strings that it returns.    
handle_format header The output format for objectHandle objects. See objectHandleFormat for the list of possible values.    
text_content_output_format header The output format for textContentDTO objects. See textContentOutputFormat for the list of possible values.    
threat_hit_prop_format header The output format for threat hit property objects. See threatHitPropertyFormat for the list of possible values.    
x-co3contexttoken header The contents of this token should be taken from the Co3ContextToken header of the JMS or STOMP message.

REST API clients that are not running in the context of an Actions Module invocation can ignore this header.

    
org_id path The organization ID.   int
limit query 50 int
max_id query   int
Response Codes
code condition
200 Success
400 Bad request
401 Unauthorized - most commonly, the provided session ID is invalid
403 Forbidden - most commonly, user authentication failed
404 Object not found
409 Conflicting PUT operation
500 Internal error
503 Service unavailable - usually related to LDAP not being accessible
Response Body
media type data type
application/json ConfigurationImportDTO (JSON)

POST /orgs/{org_id}/configurations/imports

Prepare a configuration for import. An exported configuration can be sent as a body directly to prepare for import.

Request Parameters
name type description default constraints
accept header The requested MIME type for the return. This should generally be application/json.    
accept-language header The Accept-Language header as specified in RFC2616. The server will attempt to respect this setting for any formatted date strings that it returns.    
handle_format header The output format for objectHandle objects. See objectHandleFormat for the list of possible values.    
text_content_output_format header The output format for textContentDTO objects. See textContentOutputFormat for the list of possible values.    
threat_hit_prop_format header The output format for threat hit property objects. See threatHitPropertyFormat for the list of possible values.    
x-co3contexttoken header The contents of this token should be taken from the Co3ContextToken header of the JMS or STOMP message.

REST API clients that are not running in the context of an Actions Module invocation can ignore this header.

    
org_id path The organization ID.   int
limit query 50 int
max_id query   int
Request Body
media type data type description
application/json ConfigurationExportDTO (JSON) The configuration to import.
Response Codes
code condition
200 Success
400 Bad request
401 Unauthorized - most commonly, the provided session ID is invalid
403 Forbidden - most commonly, user authentication failed
404 Object not found
409 Conflicting PUT operation
500 Internal error
503 Service unavailable - usually related to LDAP not being accessible
Response Body
media type data type
application/json ConfigurationImportDTO (JSON)

PUT /orgs/{org_id}/configurations/imports/{import_id}

Update the imported configuration. Currently this is only to accept or reject the imported configuration. If the status is ACCEPTED then the configuration will be applied to the system.

Request Parameters
name type description default constraints
accept header The requested MIME type for the return. This should generally be application/json.    
accept-language header The Accept-Language header as specified in RFC2616. The server will attempt to respect this setting for any formatted date strings that it returns.    
handle_format header The output format for objectHandle objects. See objectHandleFormat for the list of possible values.    
text_content_output_format header The output format for textContentDTO objects. See textContentOutputFormat for the list of possible values.    
threat_hit_prop_format header The output format for threat hit property objects. See threatHitPropertyFormat for the list of possible values.    
x-co3contexttoken header The contents of this token should be taken from the Co3ContextToken header of the JMS or STOMP message.

REST API clients that are not running in the context of an Actions Module invocation can ignore this header.

    
import_id path The internal ID of the import to update.   int
org_id path The organization ID.   int
limit query 50 int
max_id query   int
Request Body
media type data type description
application/json ConfigurationImportDTO (JSON) The data to update the import with.
Response Codes
code condition
200 Success
400 Bad request
401 Unauthorized - most commonly, the provided session ID is invalid
403 Forbidden - most commonly, user authentication failed
404 Object not found
409 Conflicting PUT operation
500 Internal error
503 Service unavailable - usually related to LDAP not being accessible
Response Body
media type data type
application/json ConfigurationImportDTO (JSON)

PUT /orgs/{org_id}/configurations/imports/{import_id}/status

Update the imported configuration status. If the status is ACCEPTED then the configuration will be applied to the system.

Request Parameters
name type description default constraints
accept header The requested MIME type for the return. This should generally be application/json.    
accept-language header The Accept-Language header as specified in RFC2616. The server will attempt to respect this setting for any formatted date strings that it returns.    
handle_format header The output format for objectHandle objects. See objectHandleFormat for the list of possible values.    
text_content_output_format header The output format for textContentDTO objects. See textContentOutputFormat for the list of possible values.    
threat_hit_prop_format header The output format for threat hit property objects. See threatHitPropertyFormat for the list of possible values.    
x-co3contexttoken header The contents of this token should be taken from the Co3ContextToken header of the JMS or STOMP message.

REST API clients that are not running in the context of an Actions Module invocation can ignore this header.

    
import_id path The internal ID of the import.   int
org_id path The organization ID.   int
limit query 50 int
max_id query   int
Request Body
media type data type description
text/plain (custom) The new status of the import. Current valid values are INVALID, PENDING, ACCEPTED, REJECTED, IMPORT_ERROR
Response Codes
code condition
200 Success
400 Bad request
401 Unauthorized - most commonly, the provided session ID is invalid
403 Forbidden - most commonly, user authentication failed
404 Object not found
409 Conflicting PUT operation
500 Internal error
503 Service unavailable - usually related to LDAP not being accessible
Response Body
media type data type
application/json ConfigurationImportDTO (JSON)
